title: Chopper's Brexit Podcast: Charles Moore on Margaret Thatcher’s relationship with Europe and her successor, John Major
text:
It’s the book that took 22 years to write. The former editor of The Daily Telegraph started working on the third and final instalment of his authorised biography of Margaret Thatcher while he was still in post. Charles Moore gives The Telegraph's Chief Political Correspondent, Christopher Hope an exclusive insight into his discoveries, and reveals how he was chosen to write the book by Lady Thatcher herself.

Did the former Prime Minister's 1988 Bruges speech set Britain on the path to Brexit? What was her relationship like with her successor, John Major? And did she consider herself a feminist icon?

Listen to Chopper’s Brexit Podcast on the player above to find out.
